,,, 5GHz Power Amplifier IC;Skyworks;SE5023L;SiGe, 5023L, ;2; |flags=high power |stock_os= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac |default_ssid=Amped_RTA15_2.4, Amped_RTA15_5 |default_ssid_regex=^Amped_RTA15_2.4$,,, ^Amped_RTA15_5$ |default_ip=192.168.3.1 |default_user=admin |default_pass=admin |oui=F8:7B:8C |oui_eth=F8:7B:8C |default_ch= }} ''High Power 700mW Dual Band AC Wi-Fi Router''
[http://www.ampedwireless.com/products/rta15.html Product page]
[http://www.ampedwireless.com/press/article.html?id=70 Press release] "LPCY0007 V1.6" and a date code of '''1337''' is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. :RTL8197D is the SoC used.. RTL8812AR is assumed to be used.. and RTL8192CE is probably the 2.4GHz radio. Per '''Amped Wireless'''' press release and product page... *The device has one dual-band antenna and one dedicated antenna for each of the two bands. *This device uses four 5GHz 700mW 2-Stage amplifiers, two 2.4GHz amplifiers, and four ''advanced'' LNAs. *The processor clock speed is 660MHz. The FCC ID and IC IDs are presumed to be ZTT-RTA15 and 10233A-RTA15, respectively. ==Reviews== *[http://www.tweaktown.com/reviews/5887/amped-wireless-rta15-high-power-dual-band-802-11ac-router-review/index2.html On '''TweakTown'''] :An annotated board shot is available in this review. The used OUI, WLAN Amplifier, WI2, and the switch P/Ns are per this review.
